article.title: Piano_Trios%2C_Op._1_%28Beethoven%29
article.paragraph: Ludwig van Beethoven's Opus 1 is a set of threepiano trios(written forpiano,violin, andcellovioloncello), first performed in 1793 in the house ofKarl Alois Johann-Nepomuk Vinzenz, Frst LichnowskyPrince Lichnowsky, to whom they are dedicated.Beethoven's Trios for string instruments, wind instruments and for mixed ones.All About Beethoven. Retrieved 2011-12-10The trios were published in 1795.

Despite the Op. 1 designation these were not Beethoven's first published compositions; this distinction belongs to hisLudwig van Beethoven#Background and early life''Dressler Variations'' for keyboard (WoO 63).

article.heading: Op. 1 No. 3 - Piano Trio No. 3 in C minor

article.paragraph: Unlike the 1st and 2nd piano trios in this opus, the 3rd trio doesn't have a "scherzo" as a third movement but a "minuet" instead.
This 3rd piano trio was later reworked by Beethoven into theString Quintet, Op. 104 (Beethoven)C minor string quintet, Op. 104.String Quintet in C minor, Op 104.Hyperion Records. Retrieved 2011-12-10
